item.title: Kanye West’s New “Yemobile” Resembles Batman’s Batmobile
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Kanye West, the man who is now better known as just Ye has revealed his latest whip. Some have drawn comparisons between this vehicle to Batman’s Batmobile but one thing is certain – for Kanye, it’s simply “the Yemobile.” The name of the car may be a mouthful, but it’s no stranger to making moves. […]

The post Kanye West’s New “Yemobile” Resembles Batman’s Batmobile appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Kanye West, the man who is now better known as just Ye has revealed his latest whip. Some have drawn comparisons between this vehicle to Batman’s Batmobile but one thing is certain – for Kanye, it’s simply “the Yemobile.”

The name of the car may be a mouthful, but it’s no stranger to making moves. Just last year the DONDA rapper was auctioning off six cars from his Wyoming collection which totaled over $434 800 USD! After reports surfaced saying that he sold one of these custom Ripsaw EV2 tanks for nearly half a million dollars in Diesel Brothers country – it seems like this high-profile artist has added yet another supercar onto his fleet: A modified BAC Mono named “Yemobile.”

The company specializes in making road-legal sports vehicles that only have 12 dealership agreements across four continents. Their first generation ended at the end of 2020, but they were able to come out with a new model soon after just like how we saw last year when there was also an update for their second version which went on sale around 2021 timeframes.

Expecting to be the second-generation BAC Mono, this car features a lightweight body and an aerodynamic interior. With an engine that delivers 332 horsepower for Mountune powered by VE Technology Group Inc., it can reach speeds up to 60 mph in just 2.7 seconds! The starting price is approximately USD 220k.

Let’s take a look at the “Yemobile” below.

The post Kanye West’s New “Yemobile” Resembles Batman’s Batmobile appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Pusha T & Kanye West Team Up For ‘Diet Coke’
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Pusha T is slated to drop his official follow-up to Daytona, which was released in 2018. Fans have been waiting for new music for a long time, but Push has refused to give in to the pressure. Instead, he kept supporters on the edge of their seats until he was ready to deliver some serious […]

The post Pusha T & Kanye West Team Up For ‘Diet Coke’ appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Pusha T is slated to drop his official follow-up to Daytona, which was released in 2018. Fans have been waiting for new music for a long time, but Push has refused to give in to the pressure. Instead, he kept supporters on the edge of their seats until he was ready to deliver some serious heat.

The first track “Diet Coke” was dropped on Tuesday (February 8). King Push has released the video for the track just hours after it was released. The black-and-white visual, directed by Omar Jones and Onda, features Kanye West — who co-produced the song with 88-Keys — and Pusha T nodding along to the beat while the Clipse MC fires off his iconic cocaine bars.

Push’s manager Steven Victor recently told Complex that Push’s album “is coming sooner than you think,” adding that they were coming “back-to-back.” It seems like we could be getting this Push album after Kanye drops Donda 2 which is scheduled to be released on Feb. 22nd.

[WATCH] Pusha T’s “Diet Coke” music video co-starring Kanye West.

The post Pusha T & Kanye West Team Up For ‘Diet Coke’ appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Kanye West’s ‘Late Orchestration’ Album Finally Hits Streaming
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Nearly 16 years after its initial release, Kanye West’s 2006 live album Late Orchestration is now available on streaming platforms. The album, recorded in front of a 300-person audience at Abbey Road Studios in London, England in September 2005, was first released on CD and DVD before making its way onto streaming services late Tuesday […]

The post Kanye West’s ‘Late Orchestration’ Album Finally Hits Streaming appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly 16 years after its initial release, Kanye West’s 2006 live album Late Orchestration is now available on streaming platforms.

The album, recorded in front of a 300-person audience at Abbey Road Studios in London, England in September 2005, was first released on CD and DVD before making its way onto streaming services late Tuesday night. The medley of tracks from Kanye’s first two albums, 2004’s The College Dropout and 2005’s Late Registration, is included on the 13-track project.

Backed by a 17-piece all-female string orchestra, Ye performed four songs from his debut (“Through the Wire,” “Jesus Walks,” “All Falls Down,” and “The New Workout Plan”), as well as nine. songs from his sophomore LP, including the No. 1 hit “Gold Digger” and the fan-favorite “Gone” featuring Cam’ron and Consequence.

The live album has only been available in limited international markets (perhaps due to licensing issues) until now but on late Tuesday night, fans noticed that it had also popped up in the U.S. on all major DSPs including Apple Music, Spotify, and TIDAL.

You can listen to Ye’s Late Orchestration on Spotify now. Press play and enjoy below.

The post Kanye West’s ‘Late Orchestration’ Album Finally Hits Streaming appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Official Images Of The Air Jordan 3 “Cardinal Red”
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
A classic silhouette mixed with a modern flair. The Air Jordan 3 “Cardinal Red” teaser images first surfaced online in December 2021. Nike has now officially unveiled the silhouette and its release details. Dressed in a White, Light Curry, Cardinal Red, and Cement Grey color scheme. This Air Jordan 3 resembles the Air Jordan 7 […]

The post Official Images Of The Air Jordan 3 “Cardinal Red” appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
A classic silhouette mixed with a modern flair.

The Air Jordan 3 “Cardinal Red” teaser images first surfaced online in December 2021. Nike has now officially unveiled the silhouette and its release details.

Dressed in a White, Light Curry, Cardinal Red, and Cement Grey color scheme. This Air Jordan 3 resembles the Air Jordan 7 “Cardinal” last seen in 2011. The shoe features a White leather upper with signature elephant print overlays highlighted with Cardinal Red accents on the eyelets, liner, and portion of the midsole. Other details include a Bronze hue on the Jumpman tongue and bottom eyelets.

Take an official look at the Air Jordan 3 “Cardinal Red.”

You can expect the Air Jordan 3 ‘Cardinal Red’ to release at select retailers and Nike.com on February 19th, 2022. The retail price is set at $200.

While waiting check out other Air Jordan 3.

1 Air Jordan 3 Retro Pine Green

Check Price on Amazon

2 Jordan Air 3 Retro Cool Grey

Check Price on Amazon

3 Jordan Air 3 Retro Georgetown

Check Price on Amazon

The post Official Images Of The Air Jordan 3 “Cardinal Red” appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Bad Bunny Shows Up In The JACQUEMUS’ “LE SPLASH” Campaign
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Bad Bunny is headlining more than his current tour, and JACQUEMUS has released a new ad campaign for its Le Splash collection. The Puerto Rican musician was photographed in Miami when he collaborated with the fashion label to link up their collaboration.

The post Bad Bunny Shows Up In The JACQUEMUS’ “LE SPLASH” Campaign appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Bad Bunny is headlining more than his current tour, and JACQUEMUS has released a new ad campaign for its Le Splash collection. The Puerto Rican musician was photographed in Miami when he collaborated with the fashion label to link up their collaboration.

Roller skating, Bad Bunny stars in JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

The new JACQUEMUS campaign features the photography of Tom Kneller and Bad Bunny. His 27-year old star shines through in these vibrant photos, which are styled by Zoey Radford Scott for their advertisement purposes only!

Bad Bunny wears a lime green suit for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

The gender-neutral, welcoming spirit of JACQUEMUS is mirrored by Bad Bunny’s charismatic energy. His outfits are always outlandishly fashionable and full sensory experiences for the senses. In everything from a pink dress to a lime green suit, he brings his fiery attitude with him as if it were part of himself.

Rocking a pink halter top dress, Bad Bunny fronts JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Riding a bike and wearing an embellished gray suit, Bad Bunny stars in JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Enjoying a day in Miami, Bad Bunny roller skating and appears in JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Sporting a blazer and underwear, Bad Bunny is the life of the party as the star of JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Breaking with gender norms, Bad Bunny wears a pink dress with heels for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Bad Bunny wears a yellow ribbed knit sweater for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Making a statement in a green suit, Bad Bunny fronts JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Sport matching green eyewear and shorts, Bad Bunny relaxes poolside for JACQUEMUS Le Splash campaign.

Bad Bunny goes sans pants as he sports a pink vest for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Take a look at the campaign, and stay tuned to Jacquemus’ Instagram account for more information about the “LE SPLASH” collection, which is soon to come.

The post Bad Bunny Shows Up In The JACQUEMUS’ “LE SPLASH” Campaign appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Nike LeBron 19 “Valentine’s Day” Colorway Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
LeBron James and Nike is getting into the festive spirit of Valentine’s Day with a new colorway for his signature line. The “Valentine’s Day” edition of the Nike LeBron 19 will be released next week and it has just been revealed. These flirty hoop sneakers have a colorful mix of embellishments and lovers-friendly touches. Although […]

The post Nike LeBron 19 “Valentine’s Day” Colorway Coming Soon appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
LeBron James and Nike is getting into the festive spirit of Valentine’s Day with a new colorway for his signature line. The “Valentine’s Day” edition of the Nike LeBron 19 will be released next week and it has just been revealed.

These flirty hoop sneakers have a colorful mix of embellishments and lovers-friendly touches. Although the majority of the synthetic top is colorless, it is accented with light pink grid patterns throughout. The back end is finished with a pastel orange glass that houses the little Swooshes and is bordered with milky yellow trim. To honor the February 14 festival, the midsole has been split between minty green forefoot parts and hot pink rear molds, and the internal side of the tongues has been embellished with floral motifs.

The Swoosh provides heart-shaped hang tags with an image of Cupid on them and a basketball graphic with an arrow going through it on the throat to further mimic its lovestruck concept. More Cupid-themed motifs can be found on the heels and insoles, with the latter depicting Cupid shooting a basketball into a hoop.

Look out for the kicks’ official photos here and expect these to drop via Nike soon for $200 USD.

While waiting check out the Nike Lebron Witness 5.

1 Nike Lebron Witness 5

Check Price On Amazon

The post Nike LeBron 19 “Valentine’s Day” Colorway Coming Soon appeared first on Favology.

item.title: This Artist Captures The True Royalty Of Cats With His 12 Classical Oil Paintings
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Have you ever seen a cat walking around like it’s the queen of the world? Well, they may not actually be royalty, but they sure act like it! Cats have a certain confidence and arrogance that is pretty amusing to watch. And while some people may think cats are independent and standoffish, I think they’re […]

The post This Artist Captures The True Royalty Of Cats With His 12 Classical Oil Paintings appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever seen a cat walking around like it’s the queen of the world? Well, they may not actually be royalty, but they sure act like it! Cats have a certain confidence and arrogance that is pretty amusing to watch. And while some people may think cats are independent and standoffish, I think they’re just misunderstood. Sure, cats can be a little difficult to read sometimes, but that’s what makes them so intriguing.

Japanese surrealist contemporary artist, Tohukiro Kawai is best known for his regal cat paintings. Unique and whimsical the works of this artist look both majestic and playful as they put a smile on your face with their incredible beauty! Drawing inspiration from old masters like da Vinci or Michelangelo he delivers an unforgettable visual style full of myths legends & fantasies that will make you feel like royalty in any setting – even if it’s just at home relaxing before bedtime.

With these 12 beautiful paintings, he portrays their grace, independence, and undeniable feline beauty. Purr-fect for all cat lovers!

1 Fantasy of a Pet Cat

2 The Walking-Style Coronation

The thoughts of a spoiled cat believing that it is the king are visualized in the image of an angel. The impression of the cat inheriting the crown while ambling shows its arrogant but un-hateable nature.

3 Mutualism－Livelihood Of Cat

4 Defensive Instinct

5 Fairies In The Garden

6 Bird and Actindia

7 Hallucination of pet cats to be in contact

8 Thinking thoughts smolder

9 A cat’s favourite things

10 Even angels aren’t safe from a cat’s pounce

11 Cat in a Hat

12 Intellectual cat

We hope you enjoyed this brief journey through the lives of cats depicted as royalty. Each painting is a true masterpiece in its own way, and we’re sure you have your favorite. Let us know in the comments which one you liked the most!

The post This Artist Captures The True Royalty Of Cats With His 12 Classical Oil Paintings appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Marvel Is Bringing Back ‘Spider-Man 2099’ For The Franchise’s 30th-Anniversary
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Spider-Man 2099 is back and better than ever! The modern Marvel universe has never looked so good. To celebrate its 30th anniversary, Marvel is bringing back one of the franchise’s most beloved characters: Spider-Man 2099. Writer Steve Orlando is leading this new series, titled Spider-Man 2099: Exodus, with help from artists such as Paul Fry, […]

The post Marvel Is Bringing Back ‘Spider-Man 2099’ For The Franchise’s 30th-Anniversary appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Spider-Man 2099 is back and better than ever! The modern Marvel universe has never looked so good. To celebrate its 30th anniversary, Marvel is bringing back one of the franchise’s most beloved characters: Spider-Man 2099.

Writer Steve Orlando is leading this new series, titled Spider-Man 2099: Exodus, with help from artists such as Paul Fry, David Wachter, Marco Castiello, Ze Carlos, Alessandro Mircola, and Kim Jacinto.

The plot will begin when a Celestial descends to Earth, offering a spark of hope to broken earth. Sensing an opportunity for true change, Spider-Man 2099 will go on an adventure that will take him to all corners of the Marvel Universe, from Asgard to mutant-kind.

“Roving the spinner-racks and trading cards of the early 1990s, the world of 2099 was my first future dystopia, its neon haunted visions of Marvel’s future close to my heart. And at the forefront of that future, fighting as anyone with his name always has, for the everyday folks of the future? Miguel O’Hara. Spider-Man 2099,” said writer Steve Orlando. “So here, decades later, celebrating the 30th Anniversary of 2099 is a dream come true! And there was never any question who’d be the face of this celebration…your friendly, futuristic Spider-Man!”

Spider-Man 2099: Exodus is set to debut on May 4. You can buy Spider-Man 2099 on Amazon.

The post Marvel Is Bringing Back ‘Spider-Man 2099’ For The Franchise’s 30th-Anniversary appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Artist Photoshops Her Fluffy Cat Into The Most Famous Paintings in Art History, And The Results Won The Internet
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Some people are talented in one specific area, while others are talented in many. Then there are those rare individuals who can take any talent and run with it. Such is the case with this artist,  Svetlana Petrova, and her fluffy ginger cat. The cat has been photoshopped into some of the most famous paintings […]

The post Artist Photoshops Her Fluffy Cat Into The Most Famous Paintings in Art History, And The Results Won The Internet appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Some people are talented in one specific area, while others are talented in many. Then there are those rare individuals who can take any talent and run with it. Such is the case with this artist,  Svetlana Petrova, and her fluffy ginger cat. The cat has been photoshopped into some of the most famous paintings in history, and the results are nothing short of amazing.

The project went viral on imgur a few years ago surmounting to over 4.1 million views. Check out these photos for yourself and see just how talented this artist really is!

1 Lady with an Ermine by Leonardo da Vinci (1489–1490)

2 The Persistence of Memory by Salvador Dalí (1931)

3 Liberty Leading the People by Eugène Delacroix (1830)

4 The Creation of Adam by Michelangelo (1511-1512)

5 The Birth of Venus by Sandro Botticelli (1486)

6 Whistler’s Mother by James McNeill Whistler (1871)

7 Twelfth Night (The King Drinks) by David Teniers (1634-1640)

8 The Kitchen Maid by Johannes Vermeer (1657–1658)

9 The Venus of Urbino by Titian (1538)

10 American Gothic by Grant Wood (1930)

11 Escaping Criticism by Pere Borrell del Caso (1874)

12 Bogatyrs (Heroes) by Victor Vasnetsov (1898)

13 Olympia by Édouard Manet (1863)

14 ‘The Kiss’ by Gustav Klimt

15 Mona Lisa by Leonardo da Vinci (1503-1506)

I’ve been scrolling through this list for a solid 30 minutes and can’t decide which one is my favorite! Let me know what you think. Comment below with your vote on the painting you liked the most!

The post Artist Photoshops Her Fluffy Cat Into The Most Famous Paintings in Art History, And The Results Won The Internet appeared first on Favology.

item.title: 11 Times Cartoons Had ‘Adult Moments’ That You Totally Missed As A Kid
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
You probably remember watching cartoons as a kid, and how innocent and carefree they were. But have you ever gone back and rewatched them as an adult? If so, you’ll know that a lot of classic cartoon episodes had some pretty ‘adult moments’ that you totally missed the first time around. Here are 11 examples […]

The post 11 Times Cartoons Had ‘Adult Moments’ That You Totally Missed As A Kid appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
You probably remember watching cartoons as a kid, and how innocent and carefree they were. But have you ever gone back and rewatched them as an adult? If so, you’ll know that a lot of classic cartoon episodes had some pretty ‘adult moments’ that you totally missed the first time around.

Here are 11 examples of classic cartoons with ‘adult moments’ that will make you laugh, cringe, and question everything you thought you knew about your childhood favorites.

1 Shrek 2

When Prince Charming arrives at the tower where Fiona is held captive, he discovers the Wolf instead of the princess. The character from the classic fairy tale, Little Red Riding Hood, appears to be entertaining himself by reading an interesting magazine, Pork Illustrated, a play on Sports Illustrated.

2 SpongeBob SquarePants

Sponge Bob watches a TV show in which an actinia dances to sensual music in one of the episodes. The presentation on the screen, based on Bob’s emotion, is not intended for children. It’s no coincidence that as soon as Gary walks into the room, he abruptly changes to the sports station.

This wasn’t only a fantasy made by cartoonists, though. Actinias and sponges sometimes have a symbiotic relationship. However, it is better to tell children about it in a less offensive manner.

3 Cars

Two girls (Mia and Tia) drive up to Lightning McQueen during an after-race photograph with the winners. They introduce themselves as big fans of the racer and suddenly hoist themselves up on their wheels, displaying their “high beams” to the racer. This was designed to resemble how some girls flash rock stars at concerts by lifting up their T-shirts.

4 Hercules

On a date with Meg, Hercules shares his impression of the play they both watched recently. “And then that, that play, that, that, that Oedipus thing. Man, I thought I had problems.” It’s unclear to kids why Meg is laughing at this joke, while adults familiar with Greek mythology catch the irony.

King Oedipus killed his father and married his mother, oblivious that they were his parents. That is why Hercules claims that his problems are little compared to the trials of poor Oedipus.

5 Tiny Toon Adventures

Daffy Duck is bored at the movies in one of the cartoon series’ episodes, so he begins to browse through a suspiciously named magazine.

6 Ralph Breaks the Internet

In a children’s animation, there’s another not-suitable-for-kids incident. In the scene where Vanellope enters a Disney princess’s room, the princesses demonstrate their readiness to defend their domain from an intruder. Cinderella is the one who becomes enraged, breaking her shoe in the same way that men shatter bottles in bars during brawls, resulting in a homemade shiv.

7 Frozen II

This animation contains a great adult joke. Anna has an odd reaction when Kristoff appears in front of her all dressed up, reminding her that he only put it on for an hour. “I prefer you in leather anyway,” she says as she kisses her boyfriend and strokes his hair. Kristoff feels embarrassed by these remarks, and he grins stupidly.

8 Zootopia

When Judy and Nick go to the nudist club, the poor bunny is uncomfortable and doesn’t know where to hide her eyes. Of course, that’s exactly the response the cunning fox was looking for.

9 Toy Story

In the first part of the film, Andy’s favorite toy, Woody, advises his companions not to be concerned about Andy’s birthday and new gifts. All of the toys do not share Woody’s calm demeanor. Mr. Potato Head expresses his disapproval of Woody’s viewpoint. When Slinky defends Woody, Mr. Potato Head moves his lips behind his back, thereby labeling Slinky a “butt kisser.”

The story’s first half turned out to be full of mature jokes. Bo Peep thanks Woody for rescuing her sheep at the start of the film. She says a curious phrase: “What do you say I get someone else to watch the sheep tonight?” In response to this, the sheriff laughs stupidly and says only one thing: “Oh, yes.”

10 Tarzan

When Jane draws Tarzan, she explains to her father what things she found to be unusual in this strange man and says, “And his eyes were intense and focused and…I’ve never seen such eyes.” Professor Porter notices his daughter’s feelings and jokes, “Should I leave you and the blackboard alone for a moment?”

11 Hotel Transylvania

“I was just in the pool,” the embarrassed monster replies after Wayne the Werewolf removes the invisible man’s swimming trunks. ” The water is cold. Don’t judge on me!”

So, which one of these cartoons gave you the biggest surprise? Do you remember any other adult moments in cartoons that we missed? Share with us in the comments below. And don’t forget to share this post with your friends – they’ll definitely get a kick out of it!

The post 11 Times Cartoons Had ‘Adult Moments’ That You Totally Missed As A Kid appeared first on Favology.
